business.headline: What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again after delayed rollout of utilities?With the revised ITR utilities coming out much later than expected, taxpayers and professionals are now questioning whether the government will grant another extension to ease the compliance burden.

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment out: Check your status, possible listing gainsInvestors who applied for the Mangal Electrical IPO can check their allotment status through two official platforms, the BSE website and the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Online gaming law: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

entertainment.headline: Tamil film 3BHK finds an admirer in Sachin Tendulkar. Director Sri Ganesh reactsCricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar named the Tamil film '3BHK', starring Siddharth and Sarathkumar, as one of his recent favourites. The film's director Sri Ganesh expressed his joy on X.

Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala's cryptic post: Family not free pass to mistreatActor Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala Dutt opened up about manipulative family dynamics by sharing a cryptic note. She urged prioritising mental health over preserving family image.

American comedian Reginald Carroll shot dead in Mississippi shootingStand-up comedian Reggie Carroll died after a shooting incident in Mississippi, United States. His death has shocked the comedy community and led to a police investigation.

Avneet Kaur reacts to Virat Kohli liking her Insta post: Let the love keep comingAvneet Kaur addressed the social media controversy involving Virat Kohli. At the trailer launch of her film 'Love in Vietnam', she reacted to the incident, saying "let the love come".

All about Armaan Malik's first stadium tour bringing global pop vision homeArmaan Malik prepares for his first-ever stadium show in Mumbai, culminating a multi-city tour that celebrates his evolution from Bollywood playback singer to global pop artist.

Kumail Nanjiani says he signed 6 MCU films, turned to therapy after Eternals failedKumail Nanjiani reveals how the poor reception of Marvel's Eternals deeply affected him. He sought therapy to cope with the unexpected career and personal challenges that followed.

Vidya Balan calls Parineeta her dream debut as it returns to cinemas after 20 yearsVidya Balan's debut film 'Parineeta' will be re-released on its 20th anniversary. Ahead of that, the actor called it her "dream debut".

BTS' Jin returns to South Korea to host manager Kim Taehyung's weddingBTS member Jin is back in South Korea to host the wedding of a close manager. Just a day earlier, he was seen in the audience at his juniors' concert, TOMORROW X TOGETHER.

Soha Ali Khan launches podcast on women's wellness and ageingSoha Ali Khan has launched a wellness podcast called 'All About Her' focusing on women's insecurities and ageing. The show aims to create a safe, unfiltered space for conversations on wellness and self-kindness.

Kartik Aaryan sets on a non-stop 48-hour shoot marathon after returning from LondonActor Kartik Aaryan returned to Mumbai after a relaxing London holiday. He updated about his intense 48-hour shoot marathon on social media.

Vishal Malhotra on Ishq Vishk mania: Fans scratched us, I still bear the markActor Vishal Malhotra fondly recalled the memorable release day of 'Ishq Vishk', highlighting both the film's success and the overwhelming fan frenzy that left him physically marked. The film hit theatres in 2003.

How Demon Slayer conquered pop culture in record timeIn this week's Animania we will discover how 'Demon Slayer' went from Japanese comic to global pop culture juggernaut, breaking sales and box office records with its story, art, and emotional pull.

Shriya Pilgaonkar joins Akshay, Saif in Priyadarshan's thriller Haiwaan. ReportsActor Shriya Pilgaonkar has joined director Priyadarshan's upcoming thriller Haiwaan. The film is a Hindi remake of the Malayalam hit 'Oppam' and marks a major reunion of actors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan.
Britney Spears' fans concerned after she shares nude photo with cryptic postPop star Britney Spears' latest nude Instagram post has set the internet abuzz. Fans are concerned about her well-being.

Walking Dead actor Norman Reedus' son Mingus pleads not guilty to assault chargesMingus Reedus, the son of 'The Walking Dead' actor Norman Reedus and supermodel Helena Christensen, has pleaded not guilty to a series of misdemeanour charges in Manhattan.

Singer Karan Aujla recalls surviving six gun attacks in Canada, calls Punjab safestPunjabi singer-rapper Karan Aujla opened up about surviving multiple gunfire attacks in Canada and the criticism he faced for moving to Dubai. He explained why choosing his family's safety over public perception was the only decision he could make.

Rise & Fall trailer: Dhanashree talks about broken trust on Ashneer Grover showHosted by entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, the trailer for 'Rise & Fall', was released on Monday. It gave a glimpse into the show, featuring 16 celebrity contestants, including Arjun Bijlani, Dhanashree Verma, Kiku Sharda and Kubbra Sait.

No grudges: Ashish Vidyarthi says Apoorva Mukhija apologised after The TraitorsActor Ashish Vidyarthi denied being on bad terms with influencer Apoorva Mukhija after 'The Traitors'. He said the Rebel Kid apologised for disrespectfully talking about him on the show. Vidyarthi also said that he advised Mukhija to carve her own path.

Rakesh Roshan shares it took six months to design Hrithik's iconic Krrish maskDirector Rakesh Roshan shared that it took six months to design actor Hrithik Roshan's iconic Krrish mask, which was made of wax and required special care as it melted within hours.

general news.headline: US issues notice imposing additional 25% tariffs on India from August 27In August this year, Trump slapped an additional 25 per cent tariff, raising the overall levy to 50 per cent on goods coming from India, as a penalty for New Delhi's continued purchase of Russian oil.

We'll find way out despite pressure: PM stays firm ahead of 50% US tariff deadlinePrime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the public in Ahmedabad, said that India will stand firm no matter how much pressure comes. This was in response to the US tariff of 50% which is effective tomorrow.

US tech firms not your piggy bank: Trump's fresh tariff threat over digital taxUS President Donald Trump has threatened additional tariffs on countries imposing digital taxes on American tech firms. This move escalates tensions over global digital tax policies and trade relations.

Possibility of misuse doesn't nullify bill to oust criminal leaders: Mukul RohatgiSenior lawyer Mukul Rohatgi said the new bill allowing the 30-day detention of ministers is a necessary step to cleanse politics, dismissing opposition claims of draconian intent or potential misuse.

Rare jurassic-era fossils, including skeleton and egg, discovered in JaisalmerPreliminary observations suggest that the Jurrassic-era fossil was a phytosaur (tree lizard), an ancient reptile that lived in forest habitats near river ecosystems.

Madhya Pradesh man ties up wife, puts hot knife in her mouth over dowry demandsThe victim said that on Sunday night, her husband, while intoxicated, first beat her with kicks and then dragged her into the kitchen. He tied her hands and feet and pressed something resembling a gun on her head before burning her with a heated knife in several areas. He repeatedly told her that she was unwanted.

Would destroy China: Trump warns Xi of 200% tariffs over ban on magnet exportsRelations between the world's two largest economies reached a boiling point as both sides slapped punitive tariffs on each other's goods, disrupting global supply chains.

Day 2 LIVE: Alcaraz leads against Opelka, Venus knocked outUS Open 2025 Day 2 Live Updates: Carlos Alcaraz begins his campaign against Reilly Opelka. Venus Williams has been knocked out of the first round of the tournament. She fought hard against Karolina Muchiva but lost in three sets. Earlier, Casper Ruud made it to the second round.

Trump Tower in North Korea? South Korean President's banter with TrumpSouth Korean President Lee Jae Myung, seeking to build strong rapport, praised Trump during the talks and voiced hope that Washington would take new steps toward diplomacy with the North.

Teacher sets fire to herself, daughter, 3, both die; family allege dowry harassmentA government school teacher burnt herself and her 3-year-old daughter alive in their Jodhpur home. The child died on the spot while the woman succumbed to her injuries in the hospital.

Walmart rejects H-1B visa scandal claims after rumours swirl online: ReportAccording to social media posts, massive fraud had occurred at the retail giant, and even suggested a Vice President in the company's Global Tech division was removed.

Supreme Court sets up special team to probe affairs of VantaraThe decision comes in response to multiple petitions and complaints concerning alleged violations of environmental, wildlife, and financial regulations.

Jasprit Bumrah's injuries are inevitable, irrespective of training: Farveez MaharoofFormer Sri Lanka all-rounder Farveez Maharoof explained the reasons behind Jasprit Bumrah's constant injuries. He also revealed his favourites for Asia Cup 2025 and admiration for Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Putin won't meet Zelenskyy 'because he doesn't like him', says TrumpTrump confirmed that he spoke again with Putin following their phone call last week, when he tried to line up direct talks between Moscow and Kyiv. But despite what Trump described as a "good conversation," no breakthrough emerged.

Can't sleep without your blanket? Here's what psychology saysWhen our sleep cycle is disturbed, say by a missing blanket or because we are in an unfamiliar environment, it can feel nearly impossible to drift off.

Framed in false case, ran government from jail: Arvind Kejriwal jabs Amit ShahArvind Kejriwal hit back at Amit Shah's remarks on AAP running the Delhi government from jail, calling the case against him a political conspiracy and accusing the BJP of shielding criminals while targeting opponents with false charges.

Tamil film 3BHK finds an admirer in Sachin Tendulkar. Director Sri Ganesh reactsCricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar named the Tamil film '3BHK', starring Siddharth and Sarathkumar, as one of his recent favourites. The film's director Sri Ganesh expressed his joy on X.

Highways to tiger havens: What Kanha, Bandhavgarh, Pench, Panna could gainThe Rs 5,500 crore tiger expressways project in Madhya Pradesh could prove to be a wildlife tourism boom, but critics have voiced environmental concerns
Trump seen with bruised right hand again amid health concernsAt the Resolute Desk, Trump kept his left hand resting over his right, seemingly shielding the back of it while addressing reporters.

CBSE vs ICSE: Why are there fewer ICSE schools despite its strong reputation?ICSE schools remain fewer but are highly valued for their rigorous syllabus and strong English foundations. This exclusivity highlights quality education focused on holistic learning rather than mass expansion.

Avneet Kaur reacts to Virat Kohli liking her Insta post: Let the love keep comingAvneet Kaur addressed the social media controversy involving Virat Kohli. At the trailer launch of her film 'Love in Vietnam', she reacted to the incident, saying "let the love come".

Elon Musk's xAI sues Apple and OpenAI over artificial intelligence competitionApple and OpenAI have "locked up markets to maintain their monopolies and prevent innovators like X and xAI from competing," the lawsuit filed by Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI said.

SpaceX's Starship Super Heavy launch scrubbed due to bad weatherThe highly anticipated test was scheduled to launch from the company's Starbase facility in South Texas, and was aimed to develop the world's most powerful launch vehicle.

5 journalists among 20 killed in Israeli strike, Netanyahu calls it mishapIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office described the incident as a "tragic mishap," saying the country valued the work of journalists and medical staff. He stressed that Israel's war was directed at Hamas.

Aarti shares cryptic posts after actor-husband Ravi-Keneeshaa's temple tripActor Ravi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti, shared cryptic posts on Instagram after his temple visit with his 'companion' Keneeshaa. Ravi and Aarti's divorce case is currently going on.

Tamil film 3BHK finds an admirer in Sachin Tendulkar. Director Sri Ganesh reactsCricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar named the Tamil film '3BHK', starring Siddharth and Sarathkumar, as one of his recent favourites. The film's director Sri Ganesh expressed his joy on X.

Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala's cryptic post: Family not free pass to mistreatActor Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala Dutt opened up about manipulative family dynamics by sharing a cryptic note. She urged prioritising mental health over preserving family image.

American comedian Reginald Carroll shot dead in Mississippi shootingStand-up comedian Reggie Carroll died after a shooting incident in Mississippi, United States. His death has shocked the comedy community and led to a police investigation.

sports.headline: Is that really Carlos Alcaraz? Star looks unrecognisable in new hairdoUS Open: Spanish star Carlos Alcaraz sported a new look in the first round of the US Open. The new haircut shocked many, including his close friend Frances Tiafoe.

Jasprit Bumrah's injuries are inevitable, irrespective of training: Farveez MaharoofFormer Sri Lanka all-rounder Farveez Maharoof explained the reasons behind Jasprit Bumrah's constant injuries. He also revealed his favourites for Asia Cup 2025 and admiration for Yashasvi Jaiswal.

45-year-old Venus Williams turns back the clock, but falls in fighting returnA 45-year-old Venus Williams made her long-awaited return to the Grand Slams on Tuesday, August 26. Playing against 11th seed Karolina Muchova, Williams lost in a 3-set battle.

AIFF-FSDL meet ends without ISL decision: Clubs fear possible shutdownAIFF and FSDL talks fail to resolve the deadlock over India's domestic football. Eleven ISL clubs warn of potential shutdown as uncertainty over the league's future threatens both national team readiness and continental competition participation.

US Open: Petra Kvitova bids farewell to tennis after first round defeatPetra Kvitova bid an emotional farewell after a first-round US Open exit, closing a stellar career with 31 WTA titles and two Wimbledon crowns. Meanwhile, Krejcikova advanced, overpowering Victoria Mboko 6-3, 6-2 in the opening round.

Neeraj Chopra's opponents for Zurich Diamond League Final revealedNeeraj Chopra heads into the Zurich Diamond League Final on August 28, aiming to conquer top global javelin throwers. With a stellar season behind him, he eyes victory and momentum ahead of Tokyo World Championship 2025.

Sachin Tendulkar confirms son Arjun's engagement, reveals advice to daughter SaraSachin Tendulkar has confirmed that his son, Arjun Tendulkar, is engaged to Saaniya Chandok in a private ceremony. Saaniya hails from a prominent Mumbai business family, known for their ventures in hospitality and food.

Sachin Tendulkar cracks Steve Bucknor, Aadhaar card jokes in hilarious Reddit AMASachin Tendulkar delighted fans in a witty Reddit AMA, mixing personal anecdotes with cricketing tales. From a playful dig at umpire Steve Bucknor to confirming son Arjun's engagement, the batting legend was candid and insightful.

Khalid Jamil leaves door open for Chhetri's India return: He is a legendSunil Chhetri's absence from India's CAFA Cup squad sparked debates, but coach Khalid Jamil confirmed the striker remains vital for the national team. Fans eagerly await his potential return for the October Asian Cup qualifiers.

Spouses of deceased Indian Cricketers' Association members to get Rs 1 lakh from BCCIThe Indian Cricketers' Association has launched a new welfare scheme providing Rs 1 lakh to spouses of deceased members. This initiative aims to extend meaningful support to families and will be reviewed alongside potential BCCI pension plans.

From Ahmedabad to Adelaide: Top 5 knocks of Pujara in Test cricketCheteshwar Pujara, India's resilient No. 3, retired from all forms of Indian cricket on August 24, bringing the curtain down on a 15-year career that saw him score 7,195 runs in 103 Tests with unmatched grit and patience.

Saaniya hails from a prominent Mumbai business family, known for their ventures in hospitality and food.

From a playful dig at umpire Steve Bucknor to confirming son Arjun's engagement, the batting legend was candid and insightful.

Fans eagerly await his potential return for the October Asian Cup qualifiers.

Spouses of deceased Indian Cricketers' Association members to get Rs 1 lakh from BCCIThe Indian Cricketers' Association has launched a new welfare scheme providing Rs 1 lakh to spouses of deceased members. This initiative aims to extend meaningful support to families and will be reviewed alongside potential BCCI pension plans.

From Ahmedabad to Adelaide: Top 5 knocks of Pujara in Test cricketCheteshwar Pujara, India's resilient No. 3, retired from all forms of Indian cricket on August 24, bringing the curtain down on a 15-year career that saw him score 7,195 runs in 103 Tests with unmatched grit and patience.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
